derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English māsc (used as a brewing term), of West Germanic origin; perhaps ultimately related to mix

entry.tran: 捣烂,弄碎(食物);把…捣成糊状
entry.def: If you mash food that is solid but soft, you crush it so that it forms a soft mass.

example.ex: Mash the bananas with a fork.

entry.def: A mash of food is a soft mass of food. It is often a mixture of several ingredients.

example.ex: They ate a mash of 2 potatoes, 2 carrots & cabbage...
example.tran: 他们吃了由两个土豆、两根胡萝卜和洋白菜做的糊。

example.ex: I'm feeding our horses the same mash the O'Briens used to win Gold Cups.
example.tran: 我现在给我们的马喂的糊状饲料和奥布赖恩家族夺得金杯的赛马吃的饲料是一样的。
